info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 3 at 9:53PM EDT until April 4 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh PA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of east central Ohio, including the following county, southeastern Noble.
* WHEN...Until 100 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of Duck Creek and its tributaries in Noble County is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are likely inundated with water and may not be passable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 949 PM EDT, a gauge report on Duck Creek near Macksburg indicated minor flood stage has been reached, with water levels still rising. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain has fallen over the past 24 hours in the warning area. - Another 0.5 to 1.0 inches of rainfall is expected overnight tonight, likely continuing or exacerbating ongoing flooding along the creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Caldwell, Dudley, Summerfield, Belle Valley, Sarahsville, Dexter City, Stafford, Harriettsville and Wolf Run State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT FRIDAY
